items.title: Transportation secretary announces 10% reduction in U.S. air traffic
items.standfirst: The FAA will reduce U.S. air traffic by 10% at 40 U.S. locations starting on Friday due to the government shutdown.
items.content: The FAA will reduce U.S. air traffic by 10% at 40 U.S. locations starting on Friday due to the government shutdown.

items.title: US to cut airline traffic by 10% due to shutdown, Trump transport chief says
items.standfirst: Sean Duffy says cuts at 40 locations to reduce stress on air traffic controllers will start Friday if solution not foundThe transportation secretary, Sean Duffy, and the FAA administrator, Bryan Bedford, said on Wednesday the federal government would be reducing airline traffic by 10% at 40 “high volume markets” beginning on Friday if the government shutdown does not end by then.The announcement did not specify which 40 airports would see the reduction and said that a complete list would be announced on Thursday with cuts likely at the nation’s 30 busiest airports, including those serving New York, Washington DC, Chicago, Atlanta, Los Angeles and Dallas. The reduction will affect cargo, private and passenger traffic. Continue reading...
items.content: Sean Duffy says cuts at 40 locations to reduce stress on air traffic controllers will start Friday if solution not foundThe transportation secretary, Sean Duffy, and the FAA administrator, Bryan Bedford, said on Wednesday the federal government would be reducing airline traffic by 10% at 40 “high volume markets” beginning on Friday if the government shutdown does not end by then.The announcement did not specify which 40 airports would see the reduction and said that a complete list would be announced on Thursday with cuts likely at the nation’s 30 busiest airports, including those serving New York, Washington DC, Chicago, Atlanta, Los Angeles and Dallas. The reduction will affect cargo, private and passenger traffic. Continue reading...

items.title: US to cut flights at 40 airports if shutdown doesn't end, transportation secretary warns
items.standfirst: Flight capacity will be cut 10% across the country, as air traffic controllers report experiencing fatigue, Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said.
items.content: Flight capacity will be cut 10% across the country, as air traffic controllers report experiencing fatigue, Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said.

items.title: FAA cancels thousands of flights amid US government shutdown strain
items.standfirst: The Federal Aviation Administration will reduce air traffic by 10% across 40 major markets from Friday to maintain safety, as unpaid air traffic controllers face growing fatigue and staff shortages during the longest government shutdown on record.
items.content: The Federal Aviation Administration will reduce air traffic by 10% across 40 major markets from Friday to maintain safety, as unpaid air traffic controllers face growing fatigue and staff shortages during the longest government shutdown on record.

items.title: US To Cut Flights By 10% At 40 Airports As Shutdown Persists
items.standfirst: US To Cut Flights By 10% At 40 Airports As Shutdown Persists Air traffic at 40 major US airports will be cut by 10% starting Friday as travelers continue to face flight disruptions due to a spike in air traffic controller absences during what is now the longest government shutdown on record.…

items.title: FAA reducing air traffic by 10% across 40 'high-volume' markets during government shutdown
FAA Plan to Cut Flights Might Not Be an Utter Nightmare
items.standfirst: The US government is aiming to ease the pressure on air traffic controllers suffering shutdown-related woes by curtailing flights. But airlines have experience with this kind of sudden disruption.
items.content: The US government is aiming to ease the pressure on air traffic controllers suffering shutdown-related woes by curtailing flights. But airlines have experience with this kind of sudden disruption.

items.title: FAA will reduce air traffic by 10% at many airports to maintain safety
items.standfirst: The Federal Aviation Administration will reduce air traffic at many busy airports to maintain safety during the government shutdown, which has led to staffing shortages of air traffic controllers.
items.content: The Federal Aviation Administration will reduce air traffic at many busy airports to maintain safety during the government shutdown, which has led to staffing shortages of air traffic controllers.(Image credit: Tasos Katopodis)

items.content: The agency made the announcement as it confronts staffing shortages caused by air traffic controllers.

items.title: U.S. reducing airline traffic at 40 locations due to shutdown, Secretary Duffy says
items.standfirst: The U.S. will reduce flight capacity by 10% at 40 airports starting Friday due to the government shutdown, Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy announced on Wednesday. Capt. Laura Einsetler, an experienced commercial pilot, joins CBS News 24/7 with her reaction.
items.content: The U.S. will reduce flight capacity by 10% at 40 airports starting Friday due to the government shutdown, Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy announced on Wednesday. Capt. Laura Einsetler, an experienced commercial pilot, joins CBS News 24/7 with her reaction.

ai_summary: The US will reduce air traffic by 10% at 40 locations starting Friday.
The FAA will implement the cuts to maintain safety during the shutdown.
Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy announced the flight reductions.
Cuts will likely affect the nation's 30 busiest airports.
The announcement did not specify which airports would be affected.

items.title: US supreme court justices express skepticism over legality of Trump tariffs
items.standfirst: Justices grill administration over imposition of steep duties as Sotomayor says: ‘I just don’t understand this argument’The US supreme court appeared skeptical of the legal basis of the Trump administration’s sweeping global tariff regime on Wednesday after justices questioned the president’s authority to impose the levies.Justices heard oral arguments on Wednesday morning on the legality of Donald Trump’s tariffs , a crucial legal test of his controversial economic strategy – and power. Continue reading...

Rep. Jamie Raskin said some justices may "put the brakes" on Trump.

clusters.title: France says it will ban Shein in row over sex dolls and weapons
clusters.neutral_headline: France to Ban Shein Over Sex Dolls and Weapons

items.title: France says it will ban Shein in row over sex dolls and weapons
France moves to suspend Shein’s online market over listings for illegal weapons and sex dolls
items.standfirst: PARIS — France’s government said Wednesday it is moving toward suspending access to the Shein online marketplace until it proves its content conforms to French law, after authorities found illegal weapons and child-like sex dolls for sale on the fast-fashion giant’s website. The Finance Ministry…
items.content: PARIS — France’s government said Wednesday it is moving toward suspending access to the Shein online marketplace until it proves its content conforms to French law, after authorities found illegal weapons and child-like sex dolls for sale on the fast-fashion giant’s website. The Finance Ministry…

items.title: France to Suspend Shein Sales After Finding Childlike Sex Dolls, Weapons
Queues and protests: BBC at the Shein store opening in Paris
items.standfirst: The online shopping giant opened its first physical shop in the world - in a Parisian department store.
items.content: The online shopping giant opened its first physical shop in the world - in a Parisian department store.

items.title: Shein's 'extreme obsolescence and plagiarism' provides a 'quick fix' for consumers, expert says
items.standfirst: France started proceedings to suspend online fast-fashion retailer Shein after childlike sex dolls and weapons were found being sold on its site, marring the opening of the company's first shop in a Paris department store. Speaking on FRANCE 24, Nick Rees-Roberts, Professor of Media and Culture at the Sorbonne, says that Shein's model is one of 'extreme obsolescence and plagiarism' pointing to a 'global consumer capitalism that is dysfunctional'.
items.content: France started proceedings to suspend online fast-fashion retailer Shein after childlike sex dolls and weapons were found being sold on its site, marring the opening of the company's first shop in a Paris department store. Speaking on FRANCE 24, Nick Rees-Roberts, Professor of Media and Culture at the Sorbonne, says that Shein's model is one of 'extreme obsolescence and plagiarism' pointing to a 'global consumer capitalism that is dysfunctional'.

items.title: Shein: Opens first permanent store in Paris as scandal and criticism mount
items.standfirst: Despite administrative sanctions and an ongoing judicial investigation into the sale of child-like sex dolls, the Asian e-commerce giant opened its first permanent physical store in the world at the BHV on Wednesday.
items.content: Despite administrative sanctions and an ongoing judicial investigation into the sale of child-like sex dolls, the Asian e-commerce giant opened its first permanent physical store in the world at the BHV on Wednesday.

items.title: France moves to suspend Shein over sex dolls as debut store opens in Paris
items.standfirst: The fast-fashion retailer has faced a backlash after the childlike dolls were discovered for sale on its websiteThe French government has said it will suspend the fast-fashion shopping website Shein amid controversy over its sale of childlike sex dolls.The announcement came as Shein opened its first brick-and-mortar store in the world in Paris amid a heavy police presence. Continue reading...
items.content: The fast-fashion retailer has faced a backlash after the childlike dolls were discovered for sale on its websiteThe French government has said it will suspend the fast-fashion shopping website Shein amid controversy over its sale of childlike sex dolls.The announcement came as Shein opened its first brick-and-mortar store in the world in Paris amid a heavy police presence. Continue reading...

items.title: France Seeks Shein Suspension on Sex Doll, Weapon Complaints
items.standfirst: The French government said it would temporarily suspend the Chinese e-commerce giant Shein, just hours after it opened its first store in Paris, following complaints over sales of childlike sex dolls and weapons on its platform.
items.content: The French government said it would temporarily suspend the Chinese e-commerce giant Shein, just hours after it opened its first store in Paris, following complaints over sales of childlike sex dolls and weapons on its platform.

ai_summary: France will suspend access to the Shein online marketplace.
The suspension is due to illegal weapons and sex dolls found on the site.
Shein opened its first permanent store in Paris this week.
A judicial investigation is ongoing into the sale of sex dolls.
An expert called Shein's model one of "extreme obsolescence and plagiarism".

items.title: 2 killed in U.S. strike on alleged drug boat in Eastern Pacific, Hegseth says
items.standfirst: Two people on board an alleged drug-smuggling vessel in the Eastern Pacific were killed by a U.S. military strike, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said Tuesday
items.content: Two people on board an alleged drug-smuggling vessel in the Eastern Pacific were killed by a U.S. military strike, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said Tuesday

items.title: Hegseth announces another deadly US strike on alleged drug boat
items.standfirst: Pentagon secretary says two people killed in attack on boat in eastern Pacific, bringing total killed to 66 in 16 strikesThe US defense secretary, Pete Hegseth, announced yet another deadly strike on a boat accused of ferrying drugs in the eastern Pacific Ocean, coming the same day an aircraft carrier began heading to the region in a new expansion of military firepower.The attack on Tuesday killed two people aboard the vessel, Hegseth said, bringing the death toll from the Trump administration’s campaign in South American waters up to at least 66 people in at least 16 strikes. Continue reading...
items.content: Pentagon secretary says two people killed in attack on boat in eastern Pacific, bringing total killed to 66 in 16 strikesThe US defense secretary, Pete Hegseth, announced yet another deadly strike on a boat accused of ferrying drugs in the eastern Pacific Ocean, coming the same day an aircraft carrier began heading to the region in a new expansion of military firepower.The attack on Tuesday killed two people aboard the vessel, Hegseth said, bringing the death toll from the Trump administration’s campaign in South American waters up to at least 66 people in at least 16 strikes. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A UPS cargo plane crashed after takeoff in Louisville.
The wing of the plane caught fire and the engine fell off.
The US conducted strikes on alleged drug boats.
Two people were killed in a recent US military strike.
The strikes have killed at least 66 people.

items.content: Japanese soldiers are helping in the fight against deadly bear attacks in the country’s north.

items.title: Japan deploys soldiers to contain surge in bear attacks in Akita
items.standfirst: Close encounters reported almost daily as bears intrude into residential areas and attack and sometimes kill peopleJapan has deployed troops to the northern prefecture of Akita to help contain a surge in the number of bear attacks that have terrorised people in the mountainous region.Unexpected encounters with bears are being reported almost daily in the lead up to hibernation season as the animals forage for food. The bears have been roaming near schools, train stations, supermarkets and even at a hot springs resort. Continue reading...
items.content: Close encounters reported almost daily as bears intrude into residential areas and attack and sometimes kill peopleJapan has deployed troops to the northern prefecture of Akita to help contain a surge in the number of bear attacks that have terrorised people in the mountainous region.Unexpected encounters with bears are being reported almost daily in the lead up to hibernation season as the animals forage for food. The bears have been roaming near schools, train stations, supermarkets and even at a hot springs resort. Continue reading...

items.title: Besieged by bears, Japan deploys troops to combat record wave of deadly attacks
items.standfirst: Japan’s military deployed troops on Wednesday to the country’s northern prefecture of Akita in response to a surge of bear attacks killing at least a record 13 people this year.
items.content: Japan’s military deployed troops on Wednesday to the country’s northern prefecture of Akita in response to a surge of bear attacks killing at least a record 13 people this year.

items.content: Japan has deployed troops to tackle a surge in bear attacks, which have killed a record number of people since April.

clusters.title: Mexican president to press charges after video shows her being groped
clusters.neutral_headline: Mexican President to Press Charges After Groping Incident

items.title: Mexican president to press charges after video shows her being groped
items.standfirst: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum announced that she will press charges against a man who appears to grope her while she was walking between government buildings in Mexico City, where a crowd had gathered. Police arrested the suspect, who can be seen trying to kiss the president before reaching for her chest. The country has faced elevated rates of gender-based violence, as well as violence against local politicians.
items.content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum announced that she will press charges against a man who appears to grope her while she was walking between government buildings in Mexico City, where a crowd had gathered. Police arrested the suspect, who can be seen trying to kiss the president before reaching for her chest. The country has faced elevated rates of gender-based violence, as well as violence against local politicians.

items.title: Man gropes Mexican president as she speaks to citizens on the streets
items.standfirst: Man tries to kiss and embrace Claudia Sheinbaum, highlighting security risk and harassment women face in MexicoThe Mexican president, Claudia Sheinbaum, has been groped by a man as she mingled with citizens on the streets of Mexico City, raising questions about the lack of presidential security and the level of sexual harassment the country’s women face.A video of the incident on Tuesday shows a visibly drunk man trying to kiss the president on the neck and embrace her from behind, as she removes his hands and turns to face him, before a government official steps in and places himself between them. Continue reading...
items.content: Man tries to kiss and embrace Claudia Sheinbaum, highlighting security risk and harassment women face in MexicoThe Mexican president, Claudia Sheinbaum, has been groped by a man as she mingled with citizens on the streets of Mexico City, raising questions about the lack of presidential security and the level of sexual harassment the country’s women face.A video of the incident on Tuesday shows a visibly drunk man trying to kiss the president on the neck and embrace her from behind, as she removes his hands and turns to face him, before a government official steps in and places himself between them. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum will press charges.
A man groped the president while she was walking.
